data.text: How to Protect the Frame from Bikepacking Bags?

What’s the best way to protect a lovely new frame from a weekend of bikepacking bags? Does electrical tape if wound round in the right spots a few times? Currently it has some cut up inner tubes in place but it’s a pretty heavy solution…

Helli tape https://www.amazon.com/Helicopter-Tape/s?k=Helicopter+Tape
Amazon.com : Helicopter Tape
amazon.com
data.author: Greg Sorensen

data.text: Electrical tape works fine. Only thing was that it took some of my surly decals off. Bit for the rest did its job and cheap and easy to remove. Even after months being on.
data.author: Gila Tequila

data.text:
I use racer‘s tape ￼ https://www.findtape.com/ISC-Helicopter-OG-Outdoor-Grade-Surface-Guard-Tape/p173/
ISC Helicopter-OG Surface Guard Tape - 8-Mil Outdoor Grade
findtape.com
data.author: Brian Nelson

data.text: Clear packing tape
data.author: Tyler Robertson

data.text: why bother? it is a bike. you crash it, it gets scratched. you carry it on the back of your car, it gets rock dings.
data.author: Ronnie Cole

data.text: I have some clear protective plastic product that comes with adhesive. I don’t remember what it’s called but has a peel off backing like a sticker, I have some on the bottom of my downtube to the BB shell and some on the drive side chain stay. It’s been on for 3+ years and holding up well. My frame is homemade and I painted it with spray paint. I’m pretty sure I bought from Amazon.
data.author: Eric Green

data.text: Medical elastic tape seems to work out fine. No scratches, easy to put on and off and light weight
data.author: Agustín Felipe Farelo

data.text: Electrical tape works great! I tried special bike frame protectors last year but that was leaving a super nasty residu.. had to clean it with spirit. Electrical tape is so much easier to remove yet it stayed perfectly in place during my trip!
data.author: Digna Koobecaf

data.text: Clear gorilla tape or 3m clear protection, electrical looks horrible lol
data.author: Jason Anthony

data.text:
RideWrap, either custom made for your specific frame, or their generic one for the type of bike. It took me a few hours to put it on my bike, but now I know the bike is protected! https://www.ridewrap.ca/products/
Products
ridewrap.ca
data.author: Cheryl Leskiw

data.text: helicopter tape or 3m clear bra material. My top tubes use clear bra material and helps with frame bags. I never take it off. I wrap electrical tape elsewhere under the straps. Didn't do it on my last trip and my headtube is like a mirror now.
data.author: Louis Zh

data.text: stopstone or gravelshield film is ok (used to protect car lights and body elements)
data.author: Aleksandr Geižān

data.text: I put it on my new salsa cutthroat from a new custom made frame beg
data.author: Brian Nelson

data.text: Electrical tape is great and if you buy the cheap stuff from Wilko it won’t be too hard to remove once you’ve finished your trip. I’d go for helicopter tape if the bags were a permanent fixture
data.author: Fraser Kynaston

data.text:
This is what you need. https://youtu.be/gRoqGwbhS-A
How to Clear Bra any Bike to keep it looking New FOREVER!
youtube.com
data.author: Corby Cobb

data.text:
3M Scotchgard Clear Paint... https://www.amazon.com/dp/B004VG88MQ?ref=ppx_pop_mob_ap_share
3M Scotchgard Clear Paint Protection Bulk Film Roll 6-by-48-inches
amazon.com
data.author: John Sandlin

data.text: If it’s a surly…. Don’t stick anything to the frame, the paint peels off easily.
data.author: John McAndrew

data.text:
I found this article helpful when researching this myself. Ultimately, I went with a combo of helicopter tape and lizard skin. https://bikepacking.com/plan/bike-frame-protection/
Bikepacker's Guide to Bike Frame Protection
bikepacking.com
data.author: Megan Polney

data.text: Helicopter Tape! 3M 7070UV or PU8591
data.author: Rosto Iosif

data.text: Seconded!!
data.author: Jaden Shirkey

data.text: Silicone tape, self-fusing and can be removed without sticking to the paint.
data.author: Chris Hickey

data.text: We got our wrapped in clear tape
data.author: Yin Yang Adventures
